name: Winchester Country Club
description: One of only seven courses ever co-designed by Robert Trent Jones Sr. and Jr., Winchester Country Club unfolds across 223 forested acres in the Sierra Nevada foothills above Sacramento. Perched at 1,800 feet — below the snow and above the fog — this private club offers panoramic views of both the Sierra peaks and the Sacramento Valley. The course plays through three distinct topographies: steep woodlands, rolling prairies, and dramatic granite outcroppings. Massive rock formations border fairways, streams and lakes wind through the layout, and towering pines frame every shot. Ranked #1 in Sacramento Valley and among California's top 15 by Golf Digest. The 35,000 sq ft European hunting lodge-style clubhouse won Golf Inc.'s Clubhouse of the Year 2005.
designer: Robert Trent Jones Sr. & Robert Trent Jones Jr.

faqs.question: Can groups play Winchester on a Reno/Tahoe golf trip?
faqs.answer: Yes — Winchester is the ideal first or last stop for groups traveling I-80 between Sacramento and Reno-Tahoe. We coordinate tee times, logistics, and pairing with your full trip itinerary. Contact us for private club access and group rates.

faqs.question: What makes Winchester different from the Reno-Tahoe courses?
faqs.answer: Winchester sits in the Sierra foothills at 1,800 feet — warmer and drier than the Tahoe courses, with longer playing seasons. The RTJ Sr. & Jr. co-design is one of only seven such collaborations ever, and the 35,000 sq ft European hunting lodge-style clubhouse won Golf Inc.'s Clubhouse of the Year.

faqs.question: Is Winchester a private club? How do groups get access?
faqs.answer: Winchester is a private club, but Golf the High Sierra can arrange group access for visiting golf groups as part of a multi-course trip package. Call us at 888-584-8232 for availability and private club booking.

faqs.question: What is the best time of year to play Winchester Country Club?
faqs.answer: Winchester plays year-round at 1,800 feet elevation — warmer and drier than Tahoe. Peak season is April through October. Spring and fall offer the best conditions with cooler temperatures and uncrowded tee sheets. Summer weekends book fast, so reserve 30+ days out for Saturday tee times.

faqs.question: How difficult is Winchester Country Club?
faqs.answer: Winchester is a challenging championship layout with a slope rating of 145 from the Gold tees — among the highest in the region. Eight tee options from 5,289 to 7,144 yards make it accessible for all skill levels. The RTJ Sr. & Jr. design rewards shot-making with generous fairways but demands precision on approach shots to fast, contoured greens.

meta.title: Winchester Country Club | RTJ Sr. & Jr. Golf on I-80 Corridor
meta.description: Play Winchester Country Club in Meadow Vista — a rare Robert Trent Jones Sr. & Jr. co-design in the Sierra foothills. The perfect first or last stop on your Reno-Tahoe golf trip.

bodyText: Play Winchester Country Club in Meadow Vista — a rare Robert Trent Jones Sr. & Jr. co-design in the Sierra foothills. The perfect first or last stop on your Reno-Tahoe golf trip.

Perched at 1,800 feet in the Sierra Nevada foothills just off Interstate 80 past Auburn, Winchester Country Club is the course your group should experience on the way into or out of Reno-Tahoe. This is one of only seven courses in the world co-designed by the legendary father-son team of Robert Trent Jones Sr. and Robert Trent Jones Jr., and it plays through three distinct landscapes: steep woodlands, rolling prairies, and dramatic granite outcroppings.

The course encompasses 223 forested acres with streams, lakes, and natural rock formations woven into every hole. Five sets of tees ranging from 5,144 to 7,108 yards make the layout playable for groups of all skill levels, while three par threes stretching over 200 yards demand bold shot-making from the back tees. The 35,000-square-foot clubhouse, built in the style of a European hunting lodge, won Golf Inc.'s Clubhouse of the Year and houses fine dining, a pub, and the Jones Library — ideal for post-round gatherings.

tips.title: The I-80 Corridor Play
tips.content: Winchester sits just 15 minutes off I-80 past Auburn — 35 minutes from Sacramento, 90 minutes from Reno. For groups flying into Sacramento, it's the ideal warm-up before continuing to Reno-Tahoe. On the return, it's a spectacular final round. At 1,800 ft elevation, the season runs longer than the mountain courses.

tips.title: Three Courses in One
tips.content: Winchester plays through three completely different landscapes in 18 holes — starting in steep woodlands, emerging into rolling prairies, then winding through natural granite outcroppings. The par 3s are the signature challenge: three of them stretch over 200 yards with carries over ravines and boulders.

tips.title: The Clubhouse Experience
tips.content: The 35,000 sq ft clubhouse is built in the style of a European hunting lodge and won Golf Inc.'s Clubhouse of the Year. The Jones Library is ideal for private group dinners and corporate events. The Golf Shop has been rated Top 100 in the U.S. two years running — plan time before or after your round.

pointOfView: Winchester is the hidden weapon in any Reno-Tahoe golf trip itinerary. Nestled in the Sierra foothills right off I-80, it's the perfect course to bookend your journey — a warm-up round on arrival or a grand finale before heading home. The RTJ Sr. & Jr. pedigree is unmistakable: dramatic elevation changes, granite boulders framing fairways, and greens that reward precision over power. The course plays through three completely different landscapes in 18 holes, keeping every member of your group engaged from the first tee to the lodge-style clubhouse. At 1,800 feet, you're below the Tahoe snow and above the Sacramento fog — the sweet spot for year-round golf conditions. The clubhouse alone is worth the trip: fine dining with views over the course, a cozy pub, and the Jones Library for private group dinners. Winchester turns a drive-through into a destination.
hack: The best option to play on the way into Reno/Tahoe, or the way out!
contentParagraphs: Winchester Country Club is one of only seven courses in the world co-designed by Robert Trent Jones Sr. and Robert Trent Jones Jr. — a rare collaboration between golf's most celebrated father-son design team. Spread across 223 forested acres at 1,800 feet in the Sierra Nevada foothills, it's perched in the sweet spot between Sacramento Valley and the Tahoe mountains: below the snow, above the fog, with panoramic views in every direction.

The layout plays through three distinct topographies in 18 holes. You start in steep, wooded terrain with elevation changes that demand accurate ball-striking. The course opens into rolling prairies before winding through dramatic granite outcroppings on the back nine. Streams, lakes, and wetland crossings add to the challenge, and five sets of tees (5,144 to 7,144 yards) make it genuinely playable for every member of your group.

Three of the par threes stretch beyond 200 yards and require bold carries from the back tees — #18 is the signature finisher, an uphill approach framed by massive boulders leading to the 35,000 sq ft European hunting lodge clubhouse. Golf Digest has ranked Winchester among California's top 15 courses and #1 in the Sacramento Valley.

The clubhouse won Golf Inc.'s Clubhouse of the Year in 2005 and houses fine dining, a pub, the Jones Library for private gatherings, and a 25-tee driving range for warm-ups. The Golf Shop has been rated in the Top 100 in the U.S. for two consecutive years. For groups, Winchester is the perfect bookend to any Reno-Tahoe itinerary — arrive early, play Winchester, then continue up I-80.

featuredHole.description: A dramatic uphill approach with massive boulders guarding the fairway, finishing below the stunning 35,000 sq ft European hunting lodge clubhouse. Golf Digest panelists call it 'a stunner with great land movement.' The perfect finale to an unforgettable round.

teeTimeInfo: Private club — group access arranged through Golf the High Sierra. Call 888-584-8232.

testimonials.quote: If you're driving the I-80 corridor to Reno, you absolutely have to stop at Winchester. We had 16 guys and GTHS handled every detail — tee times, carts, dinner at the clubhouse. Course was in incredible shape and the practice facility is legit.
testimonials.author: Tim W.

testimonials.quote: This was our third trip to Winchester through GTHS and the course keeps getting better. The par 3s are absolutely memorable, greens are quick and true. The clubhouse alone makes it worth the drive from Sacramento.
testimonials.author: Carlos J.

testimonials.quote: Our charity tournament group plays Winchester every year. The RTJ layout never disappoints — it's always in tournament condition. Feels like a bucket-list round every time, and the staff treats our group like members.
testimonials.author: Tom J.

rankings: Golf Inc. Clubhouse of the Year 2005
Golf Shop rated Top 100 in the U.S. (2 years running)

managementGroup.name: Duncan Golf Management
managementGroup.note: Part of the Duncan Golf Management family — play all four courses on one trip.

designerQuote: "Winchester Country Club represents the last collaboration between Robert Trent Jones, Sr. and Robert Trent Jones, Jr., who co-designed this elegant layout that unfolds across 223 forested acres in the Sierra Nevada foothills above Sacramento." — Robert Trent Jones Group
